com.github.mkrevuelta.JIntDatesConverter

Class DatesConverter.DateOnly

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.mkrevuelta.JIntDatesConverter.DatesConverter.DateOnly
  • Enclosing class:
    DatesConverter

    public static class DatesConverter.DateOnly
extends Object
    This class represents a date and only a date —no hours, minutes, seconds, milliseconds...—.

    I felt tempted to provide it with all the bells and whistles (Comparable interface, toString() overload...). Then I considered using a smaller type for month and day, just in case a lot of objects are stored. That would raise the problem of narrowing casts... But this is all beyond the purpose of this class and, in fact, it is not necessary at all.

    If you want to store a lot of dates, or use them as keys in a map, just use the Excel® date stored in a plain old int. This whole library is here to provide a fast translation of that to/from calendar date.

    Note that no public constructor accepts parameters. Two "factory" methods are provided instead. Their names are intended to mitigate the risk of messing parameters order.

    Version:
    1
    Author:
    Martín Knoblauch Revuelta

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        This method checks whether the date is strictly a valid calendar date considering all details, such as days of each month and leap years.

        Special remarks:

        • 1900-01-00 (day 0) is not valid.
        • 1900-02-29 (day 60), though not a real day, is considered valid for backward compatibility with Lotus123.
        Returns:
        true if the date is valid, false otherwise
